<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dragon's Crest](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1428)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Adjustment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=380" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 104</row>

**Price** 10 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** applied to a shield

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This variant on the shield boss is usually shaped like a dragon's head, its jaws open wide enough to wedge a small vessel of liquid within. A dragon's crest can be etched with weapon runes, much like a [shield boss](/Weapons.aspx?ID=41) or [shield spikes](/Weapons.aspx?ID=42), but doesn't otherwise alter your shield's statistics. A shield bearing a dragon's crest can't be combined with an [attached](/Traits.aspx?ID=171) weapon, like shield spikes.

 You can use an Interact action to wedge an [alchemical bomb](/equipment/alchemical-items/alchemical-bombs) into the crest's jaws. While a bomb is wedged in the shield, you take a –1 penalty to attack rolls with the shield. When you successfully Strike a creature with the shield, the vessel shatters, exposing the creature you hit—and yourself— to the substance within. This counts as a successful hit with the bomb against the creature if it's adjacent to you or a successful hit against the appropriate adjacent square if it's not. The bomb deals [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) damage as normal to surrounding creatures, including you. In addition, the bomb deals full damage to the attached shield.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Dragon's Crest
